topics.summary_text: Obtain food recall from previous day
topics.text: Obtain food recall from previous day
topics.reply:
Yesterday was not a typical eating day since Nick was with his grandmother so the mother has to recall the previous day which takes longer.

This was a useful choice to help educate your patient, but you no additional time left in the visit.

Nick’s mother read a story about fluoride being unsafe and while she knows it is important, has several follow up questions about using it for her son.

This was a useful choice to help educate your patient, but there is no time left to provide nutrition education.

topics.summary_reply:
- Soda (-)
- Juice (-)
- Some nutritional counseling provided
topics.reply:
The mother comments that she doesn’t give her son any soda but does give him juice. She does not want to cut back on his juice intake because he will not eat fruit and she thinks it is adding to his vitamin intake. She asks for suggestions on how to get him to eat more whole fruit.

This was a useful choice to help educate your patient, but there is no time left to provide a tooth brushing demonstration.

topics.summary_reply:
- No weight history
- No nutritional counseling
- Patient uncooperative behavior
topics.reply:
Nick starts to complain about the fluoride varnish, making it impossible for his mother to discuss his weight history and diet. 

You are unable to complete any education at this time.

Nick’s mother says he is not allowed to have candy but is unaware that other fermentable carbohydrates can lead to cavities. This leads to additional questions about snack foods and complications with his food allergies.

This was a useful choice to help educate your patient, but you do not have enough time to sufficiently answer the additional questions

topics.summary_reply:
- No height

- No BMI
topics.reply:
There are no height and weight in the patient’s chart. To obtain these metrics you will have to leave the room to use the scale in the hallway adding additional time to calculate the BMI. 

This was a useful choice to help educate your patient, but it takes longer than you planned.

topics.summary_text: Talk to Nick’s mom about the family’s eating habits
topics.text: Talk about the family’s eating habits
topics.summary_reply:
- Genetic predisposition to overweight
- Disruptive eating habits
topics.reply:
Nick’s mother takes several minutes explaining to you that her husband also has a weight issue and thinks his bad habits are impacting their son. Due to her work schedule he has to do the food shopping and the cooking. She is frustrated and does not know what to do. 

This was a useful choice to help educate your patient, but there is no time left to provide a tooth brushing demonstration.

topics.summary_reply: - Nutritional counseling handouts given, patient uncooperative behavior

You are unable to complete the education at this time.
